label: BODY

text: (This form must be filled out electronically.)
label: BODY

text: This form is to be used when the current version of the rule(s) has/have not previously been
label: BODY

text: reviewed.  When reviewing an interpretive or policy statement, this document is to be used
label: HH1

text: only if the review of the statement is not in conjunction with the review of a rule.
label: BODY

text: All responses should be bolded.
label: BODY

text: Document(s) Reviewed (include title):  WAC 458-61-090 Interest and penalties—Date of sale
label: BODY

text: Date last adopted/issued: 7/31/1999
label: BODY

text: Reviewer: Ed Ratcliffe
label: BODY

text: Date review completed:  8/19/2002
label: BODY

text: Briefly explain the subject matter of the document(s):  Chapter 82.45 RCW imposes an excise
label: BODY

text: tax on real estate sales. This tax is imposed at the time of sale. WAC 458-61-090 explains
label: BODY

text: how to determine the date of sale. It also explains the application of interest and penalties
label: HH1

text: when the tax is not paid within thirty days of the date of sale.
label: HH1

text: Type an “X” in the column that most correctly answers the question, and provide clear, concise,
label: BODY

text: and complete explanations where needed.
label: BODY

text: 1.  Public requests for review:
label: HH2

text: YES
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: 5.  Intent and Statutory Authority:
label: HH2

text: YES
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: the statutory authority in the explanation below.)

label: BODY

text: Section 9, below.)

label: BODY

text: effective administration of this chapter.
label: HH1

text: 6.  Coordination:  Agencies should consult with and coordinate with other governmental entities
label: HH2

text: that have similar regulatory requirements when it is likely that coordination can reduce
label: BODY

text: duplication and inconsistency.
label: BODY

text: YES
label: BODY

text: Could consultation and coordination with other governmental entities and/or
label: BODY

text: state agencies eliminate or reduce duplication and inconsistency?
label: BODY

text: Please explain. The department has exclusive authority for making and administering excise
label: BODY

text: tax rules. The subject matter of WAC 458-61-090 (determining the date of sale for real
label: HH1

text: estate transactions and applying interest and penalty to delinquent real estate liabilities) is
label: HH1

text: applied by county officials and other professionals involved in the transfer of real estate
label: HH1

text: titles. The department continues to work closely with stakeholders, including the
label: HH1

text: Washington Association of County Officials, to eliminate or reduce inconsistency.
label: HH1

text: 7.  Cost:  When responding, consider only the costs imposed by the document being reviewed
label: HH2

text: and not by the statute.
label: BODY

text: YES
label: BODY

text: Have the qualitative and quantitative benefits of the document been
label: BODY

text: considered in relation to its costs? (Answer “yes” only if a Cost Benefit
label: BODY

text: Analysis was completed when the rule was last adopted or revised.)
label: BODY

text: Rulervu.doc last revised 3/15/02
label: BODY

text: Please explain. This is an interpretive rule that imposes no new or additional administrative
label: BODY

text: burdens on businesses that are not already imposed by the law.
label: HH1

text: 8.  Fairness:  When responding, consider only the impacts imposed by the document being
label: HH2

text: reviewed and not by the statute.
label: BODY

text: YES
label: BODY

text: Does the document result in equitable treatment of those required to comply
label: BODY

text: with it?
label: BODY

text: Should it be modified to eliminate or minimize any disproportionate impacts
label: BODY

text: on the regulated community?
label: BODY

text: Should the document be strengthened to provide additional protection to
label: BODY

text: correct any disproportionate impact on any particular segment of the regulated
label: BODY

text: community?
label: BODY

text: Please explain. This rule defines the date of sale, clarifies application of penalties and
label: BODY

text: interest, and describes when payment is due. The rule provides standards which promote
label: HH1

text: equitable treatment through consistent application of the underlying statutes.
label: HH1

text: The document nonetheless should cross-reference the date of sale information for sales of a
label: HH1

text: controlling interest of an entity owning Washington real property and provide direction for
label: HH1

text: determining the date of sale when water rights are transferred.
label: HH1

text: 9.  LISTING OF DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:  Use “bullets” with any lists, and include
label: HH2

text: documents discussed above.  Citations to statutes, interpretive or policy statements, and similar
label: BODY

text: documents should include titles.  Citations to Attorney General Opinions (AGOs) and court,
label: BODY

text: Board of Tax Appeals (BTA), and Appeals Division (WTD) decisions should be followed by a
label: BODY

text: brief description (i.e., a phrase or sentence) of the pertinent issue(s).
label: BODY

text: Statute(s) Implemented:
label: BODY

text: Chapter 82.45 (Excise tax on real estate sales).  In particular, RCW 82.45.100 (Tax
label: HH3

text: payable at time of sale--Interest, penalties, on unpaid or delinquent taxes--Prohibition
label: BODY

text: on certain assessments or refunds--Deposit of penalties.)
label: BODY

text: Chapter 82.46 (Counties and cities--Excise tax on real estate sales).
label: HH3

text: Interpretive and/or Policy Statements (e.g., ETAs, PTAs, IAGs): None.
label: BODY

text: Court Decisions: None.
label: BODY

text: Board of Tax Appeals Decisions (BTAs): None.
label: BODY

text: Appeal Division Decisions (WTDs):
label: BODY

text: 8 WTD 065 (1989)(Date of sale occurs upon the time of sale.  It does not require full
label: BODY

text: payment on the date of sale to trigger the tax.)
label: BODY

text: 8 WTD 289 (1989)(Loss of tax payment in mail does not delay application of penalty.)
label: BODY

text: Attorney General Opinions (AGOs): None
label: BODY

text: 10.  Review Recommendation:
label: HH2

text: Amend
label: HH3

label: HH3

text: making action or issuance of an interpretive or policy statement.)
label: BODY

label: HH3

text: current information into another rule.)
label: BODY

label: HH3

text: decisions); or

label: HH1

label: HH1
